title: Honor Pad GT and Band 10 unveiled
description: The Honor GT Pro made its debut in China earlier today and it’s not the only new device in the GT ranks. Honor also announced the Pad GT and the Band 10. Pad GT is a midrange Android tablet with identical specs to the Honor Pad V9 but with a modified design. Band 10 is the latest addition in the smartband series, offering a 1.57-inch AMOLED display, the usual mix of health and activity tracking, alongside 14-day battery life. Honor Pad GT Pad GT is equipped with an 11.5-inch IPS LCD with 2800 x 1840px resolution and a 144Hz refresh rate. The panel features 500 nits peak brightness and...
excerpt: Pad GT brings identical specs to the previously launched Honor Pad V9. The Honor GT Pro made its debut in China earlier today and it’s not the only new...
text: The Honor GT Pro made its debut in China earlier today and it’s not the only new device in the GT ranks. Honor also announced the Pad GT and the Band 10. Pad GT is a midrange Android tablet with identical specs to the Honor Pad V9 but with a modified design. Band 10 is the latest addition in the smartband series, offering a 1.57-inch AMOLED display, the usual mix of health and activity tracking, alongside 14-day battery life. Honor Pad GT Pad GT is equipped with an 11.5-inch IPS LCD with 2800 x 1840px resolution and a 144Hz refresh rate. The panel features 500 nits peak brightness and is IMAX Enhanced certified. Honor also brought an eight-speaker setup with spatial audio and stylus support via the optional Magic Pen stylus. The tablet features MediaTek’s Dimensity 8350 chipset paired with 8/12GB RAM and up to 512GB storage. Honor also added keyboard and mouse mapping with 18 gaming titles supported at launch. There’s a 13MP main camera around the back and an 8MP front-facing module. The software side is covered by MagicOS 9.0 based on Android 15. The 10,100mAh battery inside the tablet supports 66W wired fast charging. Honor Pad GT comes in Blue, Gray, and White colors. Pricing in China starts at CNY 1,899 ($260) for the 8/128GB trim and goes up to CNY 2,799 ($382) for the 12/512GB version. Honor Band 10 Honor Band 10 is the latest in the maker’s smartband lineup. It boasts an updated design with new watch strap options and a reinforced polymer fiber casing with a metallic finish. Band 10 gets a 1.57-inch AMOLED display with 256 x 402 pixels and a 60Hz refresh rate. Band 10 pairs over Bluetooth 5.3 and can take calls from your paired smartphone. The wearable is 5ATM waterproof and does your basic health and activity tracking. It can monitor your heart rate, blood oxygen saturation (SpO2), sleep and stress levels while also tracking over 96 sports modes. Honor claims you can get up to two weeks of battery life with normal usage. Honor Band 10 Honor Band 10 comes in Mint Green, Obsidian Black, Coastal Blue, Silver Lime colors. Pricing is set at CNY 229 ($31) for the regular version and CNY 269 ($37) for the NFC variant. Honor Pad GT • Honor Band 10 (both in Chinese)
html:
The Honor GT Pro made its debut in China earlier today and it’s not the only new device in the GT ranks. Honor also announced the Pad GT and the Band 10. Pad GT is a midrange Android tablet with identical specs to the Honor Pad V9 but with a modified design. Band 10 is the latest addition in the smartband series, offering a 1.57-inch AMOLED display, the usual mix of health and activity tracking, alongside 14-day battery life.

Honor Pad GT

Pad GT is equipped with an 11.5-inch IPS LCD with 2800 x 1840px resolution and a 144Hz refresh rate. The panel features 500 nits peak brightness and is IMAX Enhanced certified. Honor also brought an eight-speaker setup with spatial audio and stylus support via the optional Magic Pen stylus.

The tablet features MediaTek’s Dimensity 8350 chipset paired with 8/12GB RAM and up to 512GB storage. Honor also added keyboard and mouse mapping with 18 gaming titles supported at launch.

There’s a 13MP main camera around the back and an 8MP front-facing module. The software side is covered by MagicOS 9.0 based on Android 15. The 10,100mAh battery inside the tablet supports 66W wired fast charging.

Honor Pad GT comes in Blue, Gray, and White colors. Pricing in China starts at CNY 1,899 ($260) for the 8/128GB trim and goes up to CNY 2,799 ($382) for the 12/512GB version.

Honor Band 10

Honor Band 10 is the latest in the maker’s smartband lineup. It boasts an updated design with new watch strap options and a reinforced polymer fiber casing with a metallic finish. Band 10 gets a 1.57-inch AMOLED display with 256 x 402 pixels and a 60Hz refresh rate.

Band 10 pairs over Bluetooth 5.3 and can take calls from your paired smartphone. The wearable is 5ATM waterproof and does your basic health and activity tracking. It can monitor your heart rate, blood oxygen saturation (SpO2), sleep and stress levels while also tracking over 96 sports modes. Honor claims you can get up to two weeks of battery life with normal usage.


Honor Band 10

Honor Band 10 comes in Mint Green, Obsidian Black, Coastal Blue, Silver Lime colors. Pricing is set at CNY 229 ($31) for the regular version and CNY 269 ($37) for the NFC variant.

Honor Pad GT • Honor Band 10 (both in Chinese)
